title: Amazon EC2
content: Instance Types: General Purpose, Compute Optimized, Memory Optimized, Storage Optimized, Accelerated Computing
Instance States: Pending, Running, Stopping, Stopped, Terminating
Pricing Models: On-Demand, Reserved, Spot, Dedicated Hosts

title: AWS Lambda
content: Event Sources: S3, DynamoDB, Kinesis, SNS, CloudWatch Events
Lambda Functions: Stateless, automatically scaled, integrates with many AWS services
Execution Role: Permissions granted to the Lambda function

title: Amazon S3
content: Storage Classes: Standard, Intelligent-Tiering, Standard-IA, One Zone-IA, Glacier, Glacier Deep Archive
Bucket Policies: Control access at the bucket level using JSON-based policies
Object Versioning: Maintain multiple versions of objects in a bucket

title: AWS IAM
content: Users, Groups, Roles: Manage access to AWS resources
Policies: JSON documents that define permissions
MFA (Multi-Factor Authentication): Adds an extra layer of security

title: Amazon RDS
content: DB Engines: MySQL, PostgreSQL, MariaDB, Oracle, SQL Server, Amazon Aurora
Features: Automated backups, Multi-AZ deployments, Read Replicas

title: Amazon DynamoDB
content: Table Structure: Tables, Items, Attributes
Read/Write Capacity Modes: Provisioned, On-Demand
DAX (DynamoDB Accelerator): In-memory caching for DynamoDB

title: Amazon ECS & EKS
content: ECS: Supports Docker containers, integrates with Fargate for serverless compute
EKS: Managed Kubernetes service, supports native Kubernetes applications

title: Amazon CloudFront
content: CDN (Content Delivery Network): Distributes content globally with low latency
Distribution Types: Web, RTMP
Edge Locations: Data centers used for caching content

title: AWS CloudFormation
content: Templates: Define infrastructure as code
Stacks: Manage a collection of AWS resources
Stack Sets: Manage stacks across multiple accounts and regions

title: Amazon SNS & SQS
content: SNS: Pub/Sub messaging service
SQS: Queue service for message decoupling, supports Standard and FIFO queues
